api package¶

This module contains classes and functions, that let you communicate with Apache Ignite cluster node by the means of Ignite binary client protocol.

To start the communication, you may connect to the node of their choice by instantiating the Connection object with proper connection parameters, like host name, and port number. Connection wraps TCP socket handling, as well as Ignite protocol handshaking.

The whole storage room of Ignite cluster is split up onto named structures, called caches. You may access the particular cache, creating the hash code of its name with hashcode() function.

Apache Ignite binary API contains a rich set of functions to control the lifecycle of caches. These functions resides in the cache_config module.

On successful connection, you may query the data on Ignite server, using either key-value subset of functions, in the way similar to Redis/memcached APIs, or SQL subset of functions, or both. Those are key_value and sql modules for you.

Submodules¶

api.cache_config module¶

Set of functions to manipulate caches.

Ignite cache can be viewed as a named entity designed to store key-value pairs. Each cache is split transparently between different Ignite partitions.

The choice of cache term is due to historical reasons. (Ignite initially had only non-persistent storage tier.)

api.cache_config.cache_create(conn: connection.Connection, name: str, query_id=None) → api.result.APIResult¶

Creates a cache with a given name. Returns error if a cache with specified name already exists.

Parameters:
  • conn – connection to Ignite server,
  • name – cache name,
  • query_id – (optional) a value generated by client and returned as-is in response.query_id. When the parameter is omitted, a random value is generated,
Returns:

API result data object. Contains zero status if a cache is created successfully, non-zero status and an error description otherwise.
api.cache_config.cache_destroy(conn: connection.Connection, hash_code: int, query_id=None) → api.result.APIResult¶

Destroys cache with a given name.

Parameters:
  • conn – connection to Ignite server,
  • hash_code – hash code of the cache. Can be obtained by applying the hashcode() function to the cache name,
  • query_id – (optional) a value generated by client and returned as-is in response.query_id. When the parameter is omitted, a random value is generated,
Returns:

API result data object.
api.cache_config.cache_get_configuration(conn: connection.Connection, hash_code: int, flags: int = 0, query_id=None) → api.result.APIResult¶

Gets configuration for the given cache.

Parameters:
  • conn – connection to Ignite server,
  • hash_code – hash code of the cache. Can be obtained by applying the hashcode() function to the cache name,
  • flags – Ignite documentation is unclear on this subject,
  • query_id – (optional) a value generated by client and returned as-is in response.query_id. When the parameter is omitted, a random value is generated,
Returns:

API result data object. Result value is OrderedDict with the cache configuration parameters.
api.cache_config.cache_get_names(conn: connection.Connection, query_id=None) → api.result.APIResult¶

Gets existing cache names.

Parameters:
  • conn – connection to Ignite server,
  • query_id – (optional) a value generated by client and returned as-is in response.query_id. When the parameter is omitted, a random value is generated,
Returns:

API result data object. Contains zero status and a list of cache names, non-zero status and an error description otherwise.
api.cache_config.cache_get_or_create(conn: connection.Connection, name: str, query_id=None) → api.result.APIResult¶

Creates a cache with a given name. Does nothing if the cache exists.

Parameters:
  • conn – connection to Ignite server,
  • name – cache name,
  • query_id – (optional) a value generated by client and returned as-is in response.query_id. When the parameter is omitted, a random value is generated,
Returns:

API result data object. Contains zero status if a cache is created successfully, non-zero status and an error description otherwise.

api.key_value module¶

api.key_value.cache_clear(conn: connection.Connection, hash_code: int, binary=False, query_id=None) → api.result.APIResult¶

Clears the cache without notifying listeners or cache writers.

Parameters:
  • conn – connection to Ignite server,
  • hash_code – hash code of the cache. Can be obtained by applying the hashcode() function to the cache name,
  • binary – (optional) pass True to keep the value in binary form. False by default,
  • query_id – (optional) a value generated by client and returned as-is in response.query_id. When the parameter is omitted, a random value is generated,
Returns:

API result data object. Contains zero status on success, non-zero status and an error description otherwise.
api.key_value.cache_clear_key(conn: connection.Connection, hash_code: int, key, key_hint: object = None, binary=False, query_id=None) → api.result.APIResult¶

Clears the cache key without notifying listeners or cache writers.

Parameters:
  • conn – connection to Ignite server,
  • hash_code – hash code of the cache. Can be obtained by applying the hashcode() function to the cache name,
  • key – key for the cache entry,
  • key_hint – (optional) Ignite data type, for which the given key should be converted,
  • binary – (optional) pass True to keep the value in binary form. False by default,
  • query_id – (optional) a value generated by client and returned as-is in response.query_id. When the parameter is omitted, a random value is generated,
Returns:

API result data object. Contains zero status on success, non-zero status and an error description otherwise.
api.key_value.cache_clear_keys(conn: connection.Connection, hash_code: int, keys: list, binary=False, query_id=None) → api.result.APIResult¶

Clears the cache keys without notifying listeners or cache writers.

Parameters:
  • conn – connection to Ignite server,
  • hash_code – hash code of the cache. Can be obtained by applying the hashcode() function to the cache name,
  • keys – list of keys or tuples of (key, key_hint),
  • binary – (optional) pass True to keep the value in binary form. False by default,
  • query_id – (optional) a value generated by client and returned as-is in response.query_id. When the parameter is omitted, a random value is generated,
Returns:

API result data object. Contains zero status on success, non-zero status and an error description otherwise.
api.key_value.cache_contains_key(conn: connection.Connection, hash_code: int, key, key_hint=None, binary=False, query_id=None) → api.result.APIResult¶

Returns a value indicating whether given key is present in cache.

Parameters:
  • conn – connection to Ignite server,
  • hash_code – hash code of the cache. Can be obtained by applying the hashcode() function to the cache name,
  • key – key for the cache entry. Can be of any supported type,
  • key_hint – (optional) Ignite data type, for which the given key should be converted,
  • binary – pass True to keep the value in binary form. False by default,
  • query_id – a value generated by client and returned as-is in response.query_id. When the parameter is omitted, a random value is generated,
Returns:

API result data object. Contains zero status and a bool value retrieved on success: True when key is present, False otherwise, non-zero status and an error description on failure.
api.key_value.cache_contains_keys(conn: connection.Connection, hash_code: int, keys, binary=False, query_id=None) → api.result.APIResult¶

Returns a value indicating whether all given keys are present in cache.

Parameters:
  • conn – connection to Ignite server,
  • hash_code – hash code of the cache. Can be obtained by applying the hashcode() function to the cache name,
  • keys –
  • binary – pass True to keep the value in binary form. False by default,
  • query_id – a value generated by client and returned as-is in response.query_id. When the parameter is omitted, a random value is generated,
Returns:

API result data object. Contains zero status and a bool value retrieved on success: True when all keys are present, False otherwise, non-zero status and an error description on failure.
api.key_value.cache_get(conn: connection.Connection, hash_code: int, key, key_hint=None, binary=False, query_id=None) → api.result.APIResult¶

Retrieves a value from cache by key.

Parameters:
  • conn – connection to Ignite server,
  • hash_code – hash code of the cache. Can be obtained by applying the hashcode() function to the cache name,
  • key – key for the cache entry. Can be of any supported type,
  • key_hint – (optional) Ignite data type, for which the given key should be converted,
  • binary – (optional) pass True to keep the value in binary form. False by default,
  • query_id – (optional) a value generated by client and returned as-is in response.query_id. When the parameter is omitted, a random value is generated,
Returns:

API result data object. Contains zero status and a value retrieved on success, non-zero status and an error description on failure.
api.key_value.cache_get_all(conn: connection.Connection, hash_code: int, keys: list, binary=False, query_id=None) → api.result.APIResult¶

Retrieves multiple key-value pairs from cache.

Parameters:
  • conn – connection to Ignite server,
  • hash_code – hash code of the cache. Can be obtained by applying the hashcode() function to the cache name,
  • keys – list of keys or tuples of (key, key_hint),
  • binary – (optional) pass True to keep the value in binary form. False by default,
  • query_id – (optional) a value generated by client and returned as-is in response.query_id. When the parameter is omitted, a random value is generated,
Returns:

API result data object. Contains zero status and a dict, made of retrieved key-value pairs, non-zero status and an error description on failure.
api.key_value.cache_get_and_put(conn: connection.Connection, hash_code: int, key, value, key_hint=None, value_hint=None, binary=False, query_id=None) → api.result.APIResult¶

Puts a value with a given key to cache, and returns the previous value for that key, or null value if there was not such key.

Parameters:
  • conn – connection to Ignite server,
  • hash_code – hash code of the cache. Can be obtained by applying the hashcode() function to the cache name,
  • key – key for the cache entry. Can be of any supported type,
  • value – value for the key,
  • key_hint – (optional) Ignite data type, for which the given key should be converted,
  • value_hint – (optional) Ignite data type, for which the given value should be converted.
  • binary – pass True to keep the value in binary form. False by default,
  • query_id – a value generated by client and returned as-is in response.query_id. When the parameter is omitted, a random value is generated,
Returns:

API result data object. Contains zero status and an old value or None if a value is written, non-zero status and an error description in case of error.
api.key_value.cache_get_and_put_if_absent(conn: connection.Connection, hash_code: int, key, value, key_hint=None, value_hint=None, binary=False, query_id=None) → api.result.APIResult¶

  • key_hint – (optional) Ignite data type, for which the given key should be converted,
  • value_hint – (optional) Ignite data type, for which the given value should be converted.
  • binary – (optional) pass True to keep the value in binary form. False by default,
  • query_id – (optional) a value generated by client and returned as-is in response.query_id. When the parameter is omitted, a random value is generated,
Returns:

API result data object. Contains zero status and an old value or None on success, non-zero status and an error description otherwise.
api.key_value.cache_get_and_remove(conn: connection.Connection, hash_code: int, key, key_hint=None, binary=False, query_id=None) → api.result.APIResult¶

Removes the cache entry with specified key, returning the value.

Parameters:
  • conn – connection to Ignite server,
  • hash_code – hash code of the cache. Can be obtained by applying the hashcode() function to the cache name,
  • key – key for the cache entry. Can be of any supported type,
  • key_hint – (optional) Ignite data type, for which the given key should be converted,
  • binary – pass True to keep the value in binary form. False by default,
  • query_id – a value generated by client and returned as-is in response.query_id. When the parameter is omitted, a random value is generated,
Returns:

API result data object. Contains zero status and an old value or None, non-zero status and an error description otherwise.
api.key_value.cache_get_and_replace(conn: connection.Connection, hash_code: int, key, value, key_hint=None, value_hint=None, binary=False, query_id=None) → api.result.APIResult¶

Puts a value with a given key to cache, returning previous value for that key, if and only if there is a value currently mapped for that key.

Parameters:
  • conn – connection to Ignite server,
  • hash_code – hash code of the cache. Can be obtained by applying the hashcode() function to the cache name,
  • key – key for the cache entry. Can be of any supported type,
  • value – value for the key,
  • key_hint – (optional) Ignite data type, for which the given key should be converted,
  • value_hint – (optional) Ignite data type, for which the given value should be converted.
  • binary – pass True to keep the value in binary form. False by default,
  • query_id – a value generated by client and returned as-is in response.query_id. When the parameter is omitted, a random value is generated,
Returns:

API result data object. Contains zero status and an old value or None on success, non-zero status and an error description otherwise.
api.key_value.cache_put(conn: connection.Connection, hash_code: int, key, value, key_hint=None, value_hint=None, binary=False, query_id=None) → api.result.APIResult¶

Puts a value with a given key to cache (overwriting existing value if any).

Parameters:
  • conn – connection to Ignite server,
  • hash_code – hash code of the cache. Can be obtained by applying the hashcode() function to the cache name,
  • key – key for the cache entry. Can be of any supported type,
  • value – value for the key,
  • key_hint – (optional) Ignite data type, for which the given key should be converted,
  • value_hint – (optional) Ignite data type, for which the given value should be converted.
  • binary – (optional) pass True to keep the value in binary form. False by default,
  • query_id – (optional) a value generated by client and returned as-is in response.query_id. When the parameter is omitted, a random value is generated,
Returns:

API result data object. Contains zero status if a value is written, non-zero status and an error description otherwise.
api.key_value.cache_put_all(conn: connection.Connection, hash_code: int, pairs: dict, binary=False, query_id=None) → api.result.APIResult¶

Puts multiple key-value pairs to cache (overwriting existing associations if any).

Parameters:
  • conn – connection to Ignite server,
  • hash_code – hash code of the cache. Can be obtained by applying the hashcode() function to the cache name,
  • pairs – dictionary type parameters, contains key-value pairs to save. Each key or value can be an item of representable Python type or a tuple of (item, hint),
  • binary – (optional) pass True to keep the value in binary form. False by default,
  • query_id – (optional) a value generated by client and returned as-is in response.query_id. When the parameter is omitted, a random value is generated,
Returns:

API result data object. Contains zero status if key-value pairs are written, non-zero status and an error description otherwise.
api.key_value.cache_put_if_absent(conn: connection.Connection, hash_code: int, key, value, key_hint=None, value_hint=None, binary=False, query_id=None) → api.result.APIResult¶

Puts a value with a given key to cache only if the key does not already exist.

Parameters:
  • conn – connection to Ignite server,
  • hash_code – hash code of the cache. Can be obtained by applying the hashcode() function to the cache name,
  • key – key for the cache entry. Can be of any supported type,
  • value – value for the key,
  • key_hint – (optional) Ignite data type, for which the given key should be converted,
  • value_hint – (optional) Ignite data type, for which the given value should be converted.
  • binary – (optional) pass True to keep the value in binary form. False by default,
  • query_id – (optional) a value generated by client and returned as-is in response.query_id. When the parameter is omitted, a random value is generated,
Returns:

API result data object. Contains zero status on success, non-zero status and an error description otherwise.
api.key_value.cache_remove_all(conn: connection.Connection, hash_code: int, binary=False, query_id=None) → api.result.APIResult¶

Removes all entries from cache, notifying listeners and cache writers.

Parameters:
  • conn – connection to Ignite server,
  • hash_code – hash code of the cache. Can be obtained by applying the hashcode() function to the cache name,
  • binary – (optional) pass True to keep the value in binary form. False by default,
  • query_id – (optional) a value generated by client and returned as-is in response.query_id. When the parameter is omitted, a random value is generated,
Returns:

API result data object. Contains zero status on success, non-zero status and an error description otherwise.
api.key_value.cache_remove_if_equals(conn: connection.Connection, hash_code: int, key, sample, key_hint=None, sample_hint=None, binary=False, query_id=None) → api.result.APIResult¶

Removes an entry with a given key if provided value is equal to actual value, notifying listeners and cache writers.

Parameters:
  • conn – connection to Ignite server,
  • hash_code – hash code of the cache. Can be obtained by applying the hashcode() function to the cache name,
  • key – key for the cache entry,
  • sample – a sample to compare the stored value with,
  • key_hint – (optional) Ignite data type, for which the given key should be converted,
  • sample_hint – (optional) Ignite data type, for whic the given sample should be converted
  • binary – (optional) pass True to keep the value in binary form. False by default,
  • query_id – (optional) a value generated by client and returned as-is in response.query_id. When the parameter is omitted, a random value is generated,
Returns:

API result data object. Contains zero status and a boolean success code, or non-zero status and an error description if something has gone wrong.
api.key_value.cache_remove_key(conn: connection.Connection, hash_code: int, key, key_hint: object = None, binary=False, query_id=None) → api.result.APIResult¶

Clears the cache key without notifying listeners or cache writers.

Parameters:
  • conn – connection to Ignite server,
  • hash_code – hash code of the cache. Can be obtained by applying the hashcode() function to the cache name,
  • key – key for the cache entry,
  • key_hint – (optional) Ignite data type, for which the given key should be converted,
  • binary – (optional) pass True to keep the value in binary form. False by default,
  • query_id – (optional) a value generated by client and returned as-is in response.query_id. When the parameter is omitted, a random value is generated,
Returns:

API result data object. Contains zero status and a boolean success code, or non-zero status and an error description if something has gone wrong.

Removes entries with given keys, notifying listeners and cache writers.

Parameters:
  • conn – connection to Ignite server,
  • hash_code – hash code of the cache. Can be obtained by applying the hashcode() function to the cache name,
  • keys – list of keys or tuples of (key, key_hint),
  • binary – (optional) pass True to keep the value in binary form. False by default,
  • query_id – (optional) a value generated by client and returned as-is in response.query_id. When the parameter is omitted, a random value is generated,
Returns:

API result data object. Contains zero status on success, non-zero status and an error description otherwise.
api.key_value.cache_replace(conn: connection.Connection, hash_code: int, key, value, key_hint=None, value_hint=None, binary=False, query_id=None) → api.result.APIResult¶

Puts a value with a given key to cache only if the key already exist.

Parameters:
  • conn – connection to Ignite server,
  • hash_code – hash code of the cache. Can be obtained by applying the hashcode() function to the cache name,
  • key – key for the cache entry. Can be of any supported type,
  • value – value for the key,
  • key_hint – (optional) Ignite data type, for which the given key should be converted,
  • value_hint – (optional) Ignite data type, for which the given value should be converted.
  • binary – pass True to keep the value in binary form. False by default,
  • query_id – a value generated by client and returned as-is in response.query_id. When the parameter is omitted, a random value is generated,
Returns:

API result data object. Contains zero status and a boolean success code, or non-zero status and an error description if something has gone wrong.
api.key_value.cache_replace_if_equals(conn: connection.Connection, hash_code: int, key, sample, value, key_hint=None, sample_hint=None, value_hint=None, binary=False, query_id=None) → api.result.APIResult¶

Puts a value with a given key to cache only if the key already exists and value equals provided sample.

Parameters:
  • conn – connection to Ignite server,
  • hash_code – hash code of the cache. Can be obtained by applying the hashcode() function to the cache name,
  • key – key for the cache entry,
  • sample – a sample to compare the stored value with,
  • value – new value for the given key,
  • key_hint – (optional) Ignite data type, for which the given key should be converted,
  • sample_hint – (optional) Ignite data type, for whic the given sample should be converted
  • value_hint – (optional) Ignite data type, for which the given value should be converted,
  • binary – (optional) pass True to keep the value in binary form. False by default,
  • query_id – (optional) a value generated by client and returned as-is in response.query_id. When the parameter is omitted, a random value is generated,
Returns:

API result data object. Contains zero status and a boolean success code, or non-zero status and an error description if something has gone wrong.

api.result module¶

class api.result.APIResult(status: int, message: str = 'Success', value=None, query_id: int = None)¶

Bases: object

Dataclass which represents the result of API request.

Fields are:

  • status: request status code. 0 if successful,
  • message: ‘Success’ if status == 0, verbatim error description otherwise,
  • value: return value or None.
api.result.hashcode(string: str) → int¶

Calculate hash code used for referencing cache bucket name in Ignite binary API.

Parameters:string – bucket name (or other string identifier),
Returns:hash code.

api.sql module¶

This part of API is not yet implemented.
